Class StriationData

Cost for a fault striation

note

Make sure that the coordinate system of the measure is the same as the computed slip vector.

note

You can use the class [[TriangleCS]].

example
const data = new StriationData({
    dataframe,
    measure: 'normals',
    compute: ['u1', 'u2', 'u3'],
    weight: 1,
    weights: 'ptsWeights'
})

Properties

Protected Readonly compute

compute: Serie<IArray>[]

Inherited from Data.compute

The names of the series to perform superposition (all must be in the dataframe)

Protected Readonly dataframe

dataframe: DataFrame

Inherited from Data.dataframe

Protected Readonly measure

measure: Serie<IArray>

Inherited from Data.measure

The name of the serie for the measures (must be in the dataframe)

Readonly weight

weight: number = 1

Inherited from Data.weight

The weight of this data. Default value is 1

Protected Readonly weights

weights: Serie<IArray> = ...

Inherited from Data.weights

The name of the serie for the measures weight. When used, each point should have a weight (number). This parameter can be skipped
